messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] Does your walking-park story have a name?
messages.msgSnippet: http://sandradodd.com/park Done, and a heck of a set of links. I messed with colors, got frustrated, and left it white.   If you have some art or a photo you
messages.messageBody:
http://sandradodd.com/park

Done, and a heck of a set of links.

I messed with colors, got frustrated, and left it white. If you have some
art or a photo you want in there I can do that.

Sandra

messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] Does your walking-park story have a name?
messages.msgSnippet: ... It s a good one for that. I figured it might be a good link to send to people who come on and want us to change the lists to suit their expectations.
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 7/1/05 9:54:16 PM, dezigna@... writes:


> I'm very flattered that you think it will be helpful. I guess I meant it as
> an allegory of the experience of people joining our RU lists, as well as
> being Unschoolers.
>
>

It's a good one for that.
I figured it might be a good link to send to people who come on and want us
to change the lists to suit their expectations. <g>

I'll put your name and probably change the name of the file too so they don't
get an advance clue. I'll call it just "park" because it's shorter.

Sandra


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: RE: [AlwaysLearning] Does your walking-park story have a name?
messages.msgSnippet: Er..no.  Well I just hadn t even thought about that. I rather like
messages.messageBody:
<<<<Does your walking-park story have a name?>>>>

Er..no.

<<<<<Do you want to name it, if not?>>>>

Well I just hadn't even thought about that. I rather like "The Beautiful
Park" and let the walking vs cycling part catch up to the reader later.

<<<<Anything you want to add to it? Intro? End note? Links you want to
have
there?>>>>>

I'm pretty sure that any links I would think of, you already have in your
site. Maybe more people will come up with allegorical tales as time goes on.

I'm very flattered that you think it will be helpful. I guess I meant it as
an allegory of the experience of people joining our RU lists, as well as
being Unschoolers.

Robyn L. Coburn

--

messages.subject: Does your walking-park story have a name?
messages.msgSnippet: Does your walking-park story have a name? Do you want to name it, if not? I have it here and will add links about getting it and transitions to unschooling,
messages.messageBody:
Does your walking-park story have a name?
Do you want to name it, if not?

I have it here and will add links about "getting it" and transitions to
unschooling, I think.

http://sandradodd.com/bikepark

Anything you want to add to it? Intro? End note? Links you want to have
there?

Sandraa
